name: UpdateOpenIDProvider
description: Update an existing OpenID Provider Registration
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `OpenIDProviders:Edit`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "BackendID": "string",
  "BaseUrl": "string",
  "ClientID": "string",
  "CountryClaim": "string",
  "CreateUsers": true,
  "DisallowOtherMethods": true,
  "EmailAddressClaim": "string",
  "Enabled": true,
  "FirstNameClaim": "string",
  "ID": 123,
  "LanguageClaim": "string",
  "LastNameClaim": "string",
  "Name": "string",
  "NicknameClaim": "string",
  "UserType": 4,
  "UsernameClaim": "string"
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/UpdateOpenIDProvider

B.name: BackendID
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: BaseUrl
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: ClientID
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: CountryClaim
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: CreateUsers
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: DisallowOtherMethods
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: EmailAddressClaim
B.description:
To identify the user an EmailAddress or Nickname is required, so at least one of EmailAddressClaim/NicknameClaim/UsernameClaim should be set.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: Enabled
B.description: While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: FirstNameClaim
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: ID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Provider`

B.name: LanguageClaim
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: LastNameClaim
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: Name
B.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: NicknameClaim
B.description:
To identify the user an EmailAddress or Nickname is required, so at least one of EmailAddressClaim/NicknameClaim/UsernameClaim should be set.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: UserType
B.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Employee
* `2` - Customer
* `4` - Anonymous
* `8` - Business
* `17` - System
* `64` - Debtor
* `256` - LimitedTrust
* `512` - Tester
* `1024` - RemovedByRequest
* `2048` - Api
* `4096` - Impersonated

While this property is not required, if it is sent in the request it must have a valid value.

B.name: UsernameClaim
B.description:
To identify the user an EmailAddress or Nickname is required, so at least one of EmailAddressClaim/NicknameClaim/UsernameClaim should be set.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: Code
D.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

D.name: Message
D.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

D.name: RequestID
D.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

D.name: Type
D.description: A short description of the error type.

E.name: ExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

E.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
E.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

E.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
